bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 15 March [1869]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: capitalized 'Walt' in salutation; added unclear encoding to 'remem'
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
dont don't be frightened at getting this unseasonable letter there is nothing more than usual the matter i am quite lame but otherwise as well as usual i hope this will find you over your trouble with the distress in your head) the cause of my writing georgeGeorge has got disappointed and dont don't hardly know what to doo do in the money matters the masons he contracted to doo do the work lumped out the plaistering plastering and they have got it all done but the last coat and smith says they wont won't finish it till they have the payment which is six hundred dollars he wants to know if you could without trouble let him have it he says he could pay you back in may May certainly he has tried every way that could be thought of smith had a man to day to look at his house he would sell it 500 doll dollars less than his price if he could raise some money on it but the man dident buy it) georg George says if it would be
march March 15
a trouble for you to get it he will doo do the best he can but if you could send him a draft for five or six hundred it would accomadate accommodate him very much indeed he wants you to telegraph to him when you get this letter as he expects he will have to go to the foundry this week he says if it wasent wasn't for our moving and his letting out the lower part he woulent wouldn't care if it did stop he feels shure sure of getting money by the first of may he has tried to transfer the mortgage on this house offered the back interest and more besides but it all failed i dont don't suppose there hardly ever was such difficuly difficulty the real estate agent say it will be very different in a little while) georgeGeorge says this building without money is a bad business i suppose walterWalter dea dear you got my letter of last week) there is 800 dollars to come from jeffJeff yet but he cant can't pay but 200 dollar a month) the houses is both insured) if you cant can't send it waltWalt without difficulty georgeGeorge wont won't think hard i told him if you could i knew you would)

closer.salute: no mormore but remem remember you your mother
